cyclone.name: HENRI
cyclone.current_location: about 230 miles SSE of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking generally north, then turning north-northwest toward Long Island and southern New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Long Island or southern New England (between Montauk Point NY and New Haven CT)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Watch Hill RI to Sagamore Beach MA, Nantucket, Martha's Vineyard, Block Island. Tropical Storm Watch: none affecting Delaware.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Fire Island Inlet NY to Montauk Point NY, Port Jefferson Harbor to Montauk Point, New Haven CT to west of Watch Hill RI. Tropical-Storm Warning: coastal NY/NJ west of East Rockaway Inlet to Manasquan Inlet including NYC.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: New Jersey shore northward through Long Island and all of southern New England; lesser effects south to Delaware and the upper Chesapeake.
weather_observation.wind: Outer bands could bring sustained winds 25–35 kt with higher gusts Sunday, low (≤19%) chance of sustained gale-force winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible (around 1 ft) in Delaware Bay; significant (>3 ft) surge not expected at Wilmington.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain Sunday into early Monday with locally heavier downpours, producing ponding on terminal surfaces and minor river rises.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated bay waves and dangerous rip currents along nearby Atlantic beaches could affect pilot transfers and small craft operations.
